It is native to the coastal regions of southern Africa, particularly South Africa. The plant is characterized by its slender, branching stems and small, blue to purple flowers that bloom in spring. Its leaves are linear and often covered in a fine layer of salt, which helps it thrive in saline environments. Radinosiphon leptosiphon is typically found in sandy or gravelly soils along the shoreline, where it plays a role in stabilizing dune systems.
